data.text: @DavidB1978 @planetjen @nzherald I mean, it is possible that vaxx pass is doing nothing at all. The study may be wrong, but like, so far there's no evidence yet to conclude that the pass didn't work.

@DavidB1978 @planetjen @nzherald Ye I agree it might make people go out more. However it is likely that vaxx make people less infectious (may not stop infection, but harder to transmit to others). So with the pass, a place filled with vac people still have reduced transmission https://t.co/k3slNTQcCA
@Carolin00953356 @nzherald yes, they should have been locked up longer. Only cost a billion a week...
@nzherald Probably because the rest of the world dealt with it at the time and are now on the other side all while we kept getting locked up now we have to deal with it

@nzherald Yes, stunning observation by the Herald and testament to their ability to read graphs. We are also one of the last to open up to Omicron after reaching high levels of vaccination. Go figure. Levels are also high in South Korea, Singapore. Denmark has reached its recent peak.

@cliff_leaf_kl @planetjen @nzherald The vaccine pass isn’t doing much at all. It offers little protection to passing it on. You could make a case for it making it worse as people may not know they have it so they go out more. It still makes sense to be vaccinated on an individual level

@nzherald Parents still take their sick children to school and swiming lesson.they are to selfish.small problem becomes big problem.if ur kids have runny nose .stayed home .omicron is everywhere now and is because of these ppl
@nzherald Overseas everyone’s stopped testing as there’s no point. Here it’s novel so we don’t have test fatigue yet.
@planetjen @nzherald Nah ..because they are testing everyone.....  Omicron is shit but only like head cold shit.
@nzherald So did Australia during peak omicron. Totally expected and not really news.
